itemLabel: William Vesey-FitzGerald, 2nd Baron FitzGerald and Vesey

wikipedia_page.main: William Vesey-FitzGerald, 2nd Baron FitzGerald and Vesey,  (24 July 1783 – 11 May 1843) was an Irish statesman. A Tory he served in the governments of Lord Wellington and Robert Peel but is best known for his defeat in the 1828 Clare by-election, hastening Catholic Emancipation across Britain and Ireland.

response: *William Vesey-FitzGerald, 2nd Baron FitzGerald and Vesey (1783–1843), Irish statesman, MP for Clare, Newport, Lostwithiel, and Ennis
